The amount of text that fits on a single page of a book can vary depending on a number of factors, including the size of the book, the font size and type, and the margins. In general, a standard page of a novel contains around 250-300 words, but this can vary depending on the specific requirements of the book. For example, a book with a larger font size or wider margins may have fewer words per page, while a book with a smaller font size or narrower margins may have more words per page.

It is also worth noting that the concept of a "page" can be different in an electronic book (e-book) than in a physical book. In an e-book, the number of words per page may vary based on the device on which the book is being read and the settings chosen by the reader.

I hope this helps to give you a sense of the general guidelines for the number of words per page in a book. Remember that these are just rough estimates and that the most important thing is to present your text in a way that is clear, coherent, and easy to read for the reader.
